publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4260 Stuart McMillan: Piping Live!—That the Parliament welcomes the launch of Piping Live!, Glasgow’s International Piping Festival; notes that the Festival, which runs between 10 and 16 August 2009, is expected to attract more than 50,000 people to the city and features the World Pipe Band Championships on Glasgow Green on 15 August; further notes that Piping Live! is this year part of the Homecoming Scotland 2009 celebrations and will feature some of the best names in traditional music, with everything from pipes to fiddles and rock ‘n’ roll as well as traditional Scottish dancing, and wishes the festival well in 2009 and years to come.
S3M-4260 Piping Live! (lodged on 27 May 2009) Jamie Hepburn*

S3M-4260 Stuart McMillan: Piping Live!—That the Parliament welcomes the launch of Piping Live!, Glasgow’s International Piping Festival; notes that the festival, which runs between 10 and 16 August 2009, is expected to attract more than 50,000 people to the city and features the World Pipe Band Championships on Glasgow Green on 15 August; further notes that Piping Live! is this year part of the Homecoming Scotland 2009 celebrations and will feature some of the best names in traditional music, with everything from pipes to fiddles and rock ‘n’ roll as well as traditional Scottish dancing, and wishes the festival well in 2009 and years to come. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Anne McLaughlin*, Liam McArthur*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Bob Doris*, Kenneth Gibson*, Sandra White*, Bill Kidd*, Maureen Watt*, Rob Gibson*, Jim Tolson*
S3M-4260 Piping Live! (lodged on 27 May 2009) Robin Harper*, Michael Matheson*, Bill Aitken*
S3M-4260 Piping Live! (lodged on 27 May 2009) Gil Paterson*
S3M-4260 Piping Live! (lodged on 27 May 2009) Dave Thompson*

S3M-4260 Stuart McMillan: Piping Live!—That the Parliament welcomes the launch of Piping Live!, Glasgow’s International Piping Festival; notes that the festival *runs between 10 and 16 August 2009;* further notes that Piping Live! is this year part of the Homecoming Scotland 2009 celebrations and will feature some of the best names in traditional music, with everything from pipes to fiddles and rock ‘n’ roll as well as traditional Scottish dancing, and wishes the festival well in 2009 and years to come. Supported by: Elaine Smith*, John Wilson*, Jackson Carlaw*, Stewart Maxwell* Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S3M-4260 Piping Live! (lodged on 27 May 2009) Pauline McNeill*, Nanette Milne*
S3M-4260 Piping Live! (lodged on 27 May 2009) Jamie McGrigor*
